revised_title: Chemical Composition of Myricine and Wax
tldr: The author, B.C. Brodie, investigates the chemical nature of wax, focusing on the difficult-to-solve portion of beeswax called myricine. He discovers palmitic acid, a new wax-alcohol called melissine, and a solid hydrocarbon called melene. Brodie concludes that waxes are chemically related to fatty bodies and are part of a larger chemical series.
